summary: This is an FBI 302 form documenting an interview conducted on August 29, 2019, with a Bureau of Prisons Lieutenant regarding his duties and observations at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, specifically concerning the housing and supervision of inmate Jeffrey Epstein. The interview focuses on protocols, staffing, and events leading up to Epstein's death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The high-profile inmate housed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC, discussed in relation to his housing, requests, and the incident involving his cellmate.

persons.name: Unnamed BOP Lieutenant
persons.context: The interviewee, a BOP Lieutenant who supervised the SHU at MCC, including the wing where Epstein was held. He describes his duties, interactions with Epstein, and institutional protocols.

persons.name: Unnamed AUSA
persons.context: Conducted the interview along with another AUSA from the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Unnamed OIG Special Agent
persons.role: Special Agent, Office of Inspector General
persons.context: Present during the interview of the BOP Lieutenant.

persons.name: Unnamed FBI SA
persons.role: Special Agent, Federal Bureau of Investigation
persons.context: Present during the interview of the BOP Lieutenant.

persons.name: Unnamed BOP Psychologist
persons.context: Reportedly stated that Epstein must be housed with a cellmate upon returning to the SHU.

persons.name: Unnamed Corrections Officer
persons.context: A subordinate officer who was informed that Epstein needed a bunkie; the Lieutenant expected this officer to disseminate the message.

persons.name: Unnamed Corrections Officer (Trainee)
persons.context: A corrections officer who, according to the Lieutenant, did not receive the mandatory SHU training.

connections.description: The Lieutenant was the SHU supervisor responsible for overseeing Epstein's housing unit and had direct interactions with him regarding his requests and concerns.
The Lieutenant communicated orders regarding Epstein's housing to this corrections officer, expecting the officer to disseminate the information to other staff.
The AUSA interviewed the BOP Lieutenant as part of an investigation into circumstances surrounding Epstein's incarceration.
The psychologist assessed Epstein and issued a directive that he must be housed with a cellmate upon return to the SHU.

events.title: Incident between Epstein and cellmate
events.description: An incident occurred between Jeffrey Epstein and his cellmate. The BOP Lieutenant heard about it the next day and a 583 packet (including memos and photos) was completed.

events.title: Epstein had a bunkie
events.description: The BOP Lieutenant confirms that Jeffrey Epstein had a cellmate (bunkie) on this date, which was standard practice after coming off suicide watch.

events.title: Interview of BOP Lieutenant
events.description: The BOP Lieutenant was interviewed by SDNY AUSAs, an OIG SA, and an FBI SA regarding his knowledge of Epstein's housing and supervision at MCC.

locations: 1 Saint Andrews Plaza, New York, New York 10007 (Interview location)
keyFacts: The BOP Lieutenant interviewed was the SHU supervisor when Jeffrey Epstein was assigned to cell 201 in the SHU at MCC.
Executive management at MCC initially wanted to house Epstein with a cellmate (bunkie), a decision the Lieutenant followed without being asked for input.
An incident occurred between Epstein and his cellmate on July 23, 2019, documented in a 583 packet.
A BOP psychologist directed that Epstein must be housed with a cellmate upon returning to the SHU from suicide watch, which was standard institutional practice.
The Lieutenant noted staffing shortages and that at least one corrections officer had not received mandatory SHU training.
